intro: Hypericoides crux-andreae, commonly known as the Andean crosswort, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Hypericaceae family, which includes several species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Hypericoides crux-andreae is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
